WebDev.title: Reddit Sentiment Tracker
WebDev.description: This project features a real-time dashboard displaying sentiment and emotion trends for four main political parties on Reddit during the 2024 election. We developed a pipeline to process streaming data using Kafka, deployed on the Cloud, and stored the sentiment scores in CouchDB for timely insights and analysis.

WebDev.title: Movie Recommender
WebDev.description: This is a movie recommender using microservices and built with Spring WebFlux and Project Reactor's ParallelFlux, enabling asynchronous, parallelized processing for providing movie recommendations.

WebDev.title: ParkShare Platform
WebDev.description: The project supports users to browse and add information about national parks, including comments and ratings. I used Redis cache to enhance backend performance and data retrieval and deployed on GCP using Docker containers.

WebDev.title: WeChat Rep Counter
WebDev.description: In this capstone project, I developed a WeChat mini-app that tracks users' indoor exercises in real-time and keeps a history, including rope jumping, push-ups, squats, and crunches. Using Mediapipe, a deep-learning framework for posture recognition, I designed an algorithm to count repetitions.

DS.title: Source Code Categorization
DS.description: This project involved transforming 12GB of labeled C++ code into Abstract Syntax Trees (AST) stored in PyTorch Geometric format, and achieving 83% test accuracy on code classification using a tuned Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) model.

DS.title: Asurion's IPhone Claims Prediction
DS.description: In this project, we achieved a 26% WMAP Error in predicting iPhone claims for the following month for Asurion by performing data cleaning, feature engineering, and time-series analysis. Utilizing Gradient Boosting, we uncovered patterns and trends, providing valuable insights for timely decision-making to optimize storage.

DS.title: Jenny's Personality Shifts
DS.description: We domain-adapted transformer models to understand personality shifts in Jenny's letters following a significant life change. We transformed over 200 letters into Hugging Face-compatible JSON format and used advanced statistical analysis and data visualization to effectively showcase the models' ability to learn and represent these personality shifts.

DS.title: Masked Face Verification
DS.description: We developed and trained a contrastive learning model on a modified SimCLR framework in PyTorch to address masked face verification challenges during COVID-19, achieving 60% testing verification accuracy compared to a 47.5% baseline and resulting in a published paper.
